title: Clap derive expansion no longer works on stable

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

labels.name: E-needs-bisection
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs bisection: https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo-bisect-rustc

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a regression report! 🐛 A regression is something that changed between versions of Rust but was not supposed to.

Please provide a short summary of the regression, along with any information you feel is relevant to replicate it.
-->

### Code

[Clap](https://github.com/clap-rs/clap) has the following test at `clap_derive/tests/nested.rs`:

```rust
use clap::Clap;

#[test]
fn use_option() {
    macro_rules! expand_ty {
        ($name:ident: $ty:ty) => {
            #[derive(Clap)]
            struct Outer {
                #[clap(short, long)]
                #[allow(dead_code)]
                $name: $ty,
            }
        };
    }

    expand_ty!(my_field: Option<String>);
}
```

As you can see from the latest [master CI](https://github.com/clap-rs/clap/actions/runs/388643619), it fails to compile on [stable](https://github.com/clap-rs/clap/runs/1467319265?check_suite_focus=true)

### Version it worked on

<!--
Provide the most recent version this worked on, for example:

It most recently worked on: Rust 1.47
-->

It most recently worked on: Successfully compiles and runs on [1.46.0](https://github.com/clap-rs/clap/runs/1467319100?check_suite_focus=true)

### Version with regression

<!--
Provide the version you are using that has the regression.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.48.0 (7eac88abb 2020-11-16)
```

<!--
If you know when this regression occurred, please add a line like below, replacing `{channel}` with one of stable, beta, or nightly.

@rustbot modify labels: +regression-from-stable-to-{channel} -regression-untriaged
-->
